update.description:
Adds a menu to insert 3D models from the database.

* Tool to generate a thumbnail for each model
* Desktop: From insert menu, insert models by `click+hover+click` or `click+drag`
* Mobile: From insert menu, insert models by `tap+drag` or `long press+drag`
* For now, temp model during spawn is a box
update.title: Insert menu

content.raw: gazebo should automatically download the missing models from `www.gazebosim.org/models`. Try inserting them from gzclient and see if it retrieves these models and adds them to your `.gazebo/models` dir
content.html: gazebo should automatically download the missing models from www.gazebosim.org/models. Try inserting them from gzclient and see if it retrieves these models and adds them to your .gazebo/models dir

content.raw:
Wow, this is much simpler! I did it like this and it works for most models:


```
#!c++

newModelStr << "<sdf version ='" << SDF_VERSION << "'>"
            << "<model name='" << name << "'>"
            << "  <include>"
            << "    <pose>" << pos.x << " " << pos.y << " "
                            << pos.z << " " << rpy.x << " "
                            << rpy.y << " " << rpy.z << "</pose>"
            << "    <uri>model://" << type << "</uri>"
            << "  </include>"
            << "</model>"
            << "</sdf>";
```


However, it seems like there are some models missing in my `.gazebo/models` folder, such as `breakable_test`, `drc_practice_angled_barrier_45`, `simple_arm_gripper` and some others. Have I forgot to install something?
content.html:
Wow, this is much simpler! I did it like this and it works for most models:

newModelStr << "<sdf version ='" << SDF_VERSION << "'>"
            << "<model name='" << name << "'>"
            << "  <include>"
            << "    <pose>" << pos.x << " " << pos.y << " "
                            << pos.z << " " << rpy.x << " "
                            << rpy.y << " " << rpy.z << "</pose>"
            << "    <uri>model://" << type << "</uri>"
            << "  </include>"
            << "</model>"
            << "</sdf>";

However, it seems like there are some models missing in my .gazebo/models folder, such as breakable_test, drc_practice_angled_barrier_45, simple_arm_gripper and some others. Have I forgot to install something?

content.raw: I am not an expert in this but can the formatting be done in css?
content.html: I am not an expert in this but can the formatting be done in css?

content.raw: define a variable for `../http/client/assets` and use it in the rest of the file?
content.html: define a variable for ../http/client/assets and use it in the rest of the file?

content.raw: I think you can leave out the physics, audio, spherical_coordinates, and state tags
content.html: I think you can leave out the physics, audio, spherical_coordinates, and state tags

content.raw:
There is actually a simpler way to override model properties. You can construct a new sdf string to include the original model and overwrite it's properties, 

e.g. you can give a new name and override the pose like below




```
#!xml

<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<sdf version="1.5">
  <model name="new_model_name">
    <include>
      <pose>1.8 0 1 0 0 0</pose>
      <uri>model://simple_arm</uri>
    </include>
  </model>
</sdf>

```
content.html:
There is actually a simpler way to override model properties. You can construct a new sdf string to include the original model and overwrite it's properties,

e.g. you can give a new name and override the pose like below

<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<sdf version="1.5">
  <model name="new_model_name">
    <include>
      <pose>1.8 0 1 0 0 0</pose>
      <uri>model://simple_arm</uri>
    </include>
  </model>
</sdf>

content.raw: can you document the below code to describe what's being added to the sdf?
content.html: can you document the below code to describe what's being added to the sdf?

content.raw:
let's define a macro for the asset path on top of the file and use it here, i.e.


```
#!c++

#define GZWEB_RESOURCE_PATH "../http/client/assets/"
```
content.html:
let's define a macro for the asset path on top of the file and use it here, i.e.

#define GZWEB_RESOURCE_PATH "../http/client/assets/"

content.raw: can you document what the 14 char contains? `insert-entity-` ?
content.html: can you document what the 14 char contains? insert-entity- ?
